title: Do Australian universities like IB (International Baccalaureate)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, they do. They are generous in converting IB points to the ATAR equivalent. For example, to get into Bachelor of Science in the University of Melbourne, you just need 31/45 points in the IB Diploma for guaranteed entry. By comparison, the lowest ATAR that would be accepted is 85.00 for the same degree. Bachelor of Science However, the situation is different of course for very competitive courses such as Dentistry or Medicine.

In that you can use IB marks to get into an Australian university degree, yes they do. A small number of Australian schools do (or offer as an option) the IB curriculum, so there’s a conversion from those marks to the more “regular” ones most students receive. There can sometimes be issues to do with the release of marks for the IB versus cutoffs to apply for scholarships and the like, but that’s a different story.
